Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png
What's the meaning of this? Why did they mention Amberia's name?!
Oh. You think I'm playing her like a puppet?
Are you not?
I can only influence her dreams. I can't control her directly.
Then what's the deal with the bionics?!
I only said I'd give you a chance, not work with you as an equal. If you want me to uphold my end of the promise, you'd better go harder at it, dear.
...You!
Seems like you really want out, Amberia. Don't you?
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory91.png
Staessen
You people... What are you trying to get outta me...
After ensuring the safety of the area, you and Rosetta went over to Captain Staessen according to Rosetta's proposal and asked him about Amberia.
You had expected some clues or answers, but the result was unexpected.
Upon hearing Amberia's name, Staessen immediately dismissed the guards with an apprehensive expression on his face. He must know something.
Atiel
You... You can't possibly know about Amberia, can you?!
Atiel could not help but lose her temper over Staessen's inane muttering. She stomps forth and grabs his collar.
Staessen
Hey!
Simon
Stop, Atiel! He's on our side!
Atiel
Atiel lets go, but gives Staessen a piercing glare.
Rosetta
So what is it? Is Amberia still alive?
Staessen
We need to know everything that's going on.
Do you want to relive that tragedy?
Staessen
What's the point? It's not like you can do anything about it. This will just be like the previous tides, it'll come to an end soon... Ah...
Staessen
There won't be no "tragedy." We easily snuffed out the last tide, and we'll do it again this time... Ah...
Diana
So, she really is alive then?
Staessen's broken mumblings confirm the suspicions within your heart.
Diana
Tell me, Captain. Why did you try to cover it up? Where is she now? How can you tolerate this?!
Even Diana lets out her anger. The name Amberia is evidently a monument in the heart of the Forest Guard.
Staessen
...I wasn't trying to cover it up. No, I never did!
Diana
What?
Staessen
It was the previous captain, and the ones before. THEY did that! Every new captain is ordered to keep it a secret. If I had known this from the beginning, I would never have tried to be one!
Like a crumbling tower, Staessen grabs and pulls at his hair, shrieking angrily at you and the others.
Then, can you tell us the truth?
Why keep it a secret then?
Staessen
...Ugh, why'd it turn out like this?
Staessen
I wasn't trying to! But who'd believe me? And you know what happens to traitors!
Staessen
Not to mention, if I were to tell everyone that Amberia was still alive, the ARU would delve into chaos. If we ran into any trouble during so, we'd all...
Staessen
...Oh, forget it! I don't care anymore! You wanna know the truth, I'll tell you truth! But you better not tell anyone else!
The room falls into silence. Staessen begins spitting out everything he knows.
Staessen
I don't know exactly HOW, but the ARU used a code to suppress Amberia.
Simon
A code... So some kind of preset authentication?
Staessen
Something like that... Anyway, the leaders in control of the code put Amberia into a deep sleep. They then sealed her and the bionics away somewhere in this tundra.
Staessen
...First things first though. I don't know where either.
Atiel
...How can you NOT KNOW? You're not messing with us, are you?
Staessen
I REALLY DON'T! All I heard from the previous captain was that Amberia's nightmares are what's controlling the tide.
Simon
The nightmares are disturbing her M.I.N.D., causing the linked bionics to attack people on the surface?
Staessen
That's what should be the case this time round as well. The bionics also mentioned Amberia, yeah?
Staessen
When her nightmare ends, she will return to her deep slumber. That will put the bionics to rest.
Simon
That doesn't seem likely.
Staessen
...Why?
Simon
Before that, I need to confirm something, Boss. Did you see bionics carrying away energy tanks before our rendezvous?
You mean the energy tanks in the base...?
What do you think they're planning?
Simon
Yeah, that's what I was in a hurry to confirm just now. Most of the energy in the base were stolen.
Simon
They must be trying to activate some sort of special machine.
Staessen
Wait... You don't mean? They're hauling the energy tanks to Amberia?
Simon
Not much else they'd need so many energy tanks for, I'm afraid... Looks like sleeping beauty is about to wake up.
Staessen
No... That can't be. If she awakens, there's no way we can defeat her. She must be trying to get revenge on the ARU...
The pace of Staessen's speech quickens, growing more erratic by the second. He tries to scamper for the shipyard, but is blocked off by Rosetta.
Rosetta
We'll have to fight to see if we win or lose. But for now, we still have a way out... The code... Do you really not have any idea about it?
Staessen
...You might find something in the research lab. I'm sure you Forest Guards are familiar with it—the lab used to make Constructs.
Staessen
I don't know what's in there, but you should hurry. If you can find the code, we can put Amberia back to sleep again.
Rosetta
Whether she's back or not, as long as we have the code, we will always have the upper hand, huh...
Well then, let's go search for the code.
Do we still have time?
Rosetta
Heh, we think alike.
Rosetta
No other choice, Commandant. Let's get going.
Atiel
She's right, Boss. Let's get other Constructs to fortify a defensive line while we look for the code!
